intro: Dipholis repens, commonly known as the running flax, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems that allow it to climb other vegetation. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Dipholis repens is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used traditionally in herbal remedies.
